title: @Meddler can we add the "!" indicator back to camouflage champs when turrets can see you?
body:
I feel like I have an unfair advantage against new players, because I've memorized all the spots and paths where turrets can and can't see me. The only way someone can learn to do that now is by multi-clienting on 2 computers and testing it in a custom. It's dumb.

(This applies to Twitch, Rengar etc too).

http://i.imgur.com/GiiTBdf.png/img

replies.body: I'll follow up on that, I suspect its removal was an oversight.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=dJTZEFY4,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-12-02T23:42:23.101+0000)
>
> I'll follow up on that, I suspect its removal was an oversight.

Offtopic Meddler Check Twitch detect range of his camouflage pls.
This is what make him too strong, It's like release Rengar.
Add a sort of warning when Twitch is near so you have time to react and use a control ward or increase detect range to half of this AA range during ultimate, so you can flash out of it.

Or add a unique audio cue that clues you in whenever he's within range (a greater range than his visibility radius, obviously.)

I mean, aural and visual cues are like Stealth Game Basics 101. Looking Glass Studios had this stuff figured out with The Dark Project back in '98. C'mon Riot.

They're already nerfing his stealth (duration at lower ranks) and it hasn't gone live yet. Maybe chill and see how it pans out.

Awesome ty

What are your thoughts on specific audio cues unique to Evelynn and Twitch whenever they're around (within a larger range than their detection radius?) 

Currently, Rengar is the only champion with invisibility that has a SFX that denotes when he's near. (Actually, Shaco has an evil laugh upon disappearing, but it's practically inaudible.)
